ThingDef.label: UACM Cap
ThingDef.description: Marines cap

ThingDef.label: Lightweight Helmet
ThingDef.description: Marines Lightweight Helmet

ThingDef.label: Enhanced Helmet
ThingDef.description: Marines Enhanced Helmet

ThingDef.label: Elite Fireteam Armor
ThingDef.description: "The Colonial Marines are the major striking element of the United Americas Allied Command, and is the nation's only major means of forcibly entering a hostile area from space."

ThingDef.label: Kramer .50 Magnum
ThingDef.description: The Kramer .50 Magnum was a handgun manufactured by Kramer Metallarbeiten GmBH and used by the United States Colonial Marine Corps and the Office of the Colonial Marshals during the late 22nd century.

ThingDef.label: Kramer Short-Barrel
ThingDef.description: The Kramer Short-Barrel was a hand-held riot gun built under license by Armat Battlefield Systems. It was notably employed by the United States Colonial Marine Corps during the late 22nd century.

ThingDef.label: L56A3 Smartgun
ThingDef.description: The Weyland-Yutani Corporation L56A3 Smartgun was a variant of Armat Battlefield Systems' M56 Smartgun. It was notably employed by the Three World Empire and the United States Colonial Marine Corps during the 22nd century.

ThingDef.label: M10 Auto Pistol
ThingDef.description: The M10 Auto Pistol was a machine pistol manufactured by Armat Battlefield Systems. It was notably employed by the United States Colonial Marine Corps and the United Americas Aerospace Force during the late 22nd century.

ThingDef.label: M12 RPG Launcher
ThingDef.description: The Armat Battlefield Systems M12 RPG Launcher was an anti-vehicle rocket launcher that saw service with the United States Colonial Marine Corps and the Canadian Colonial Armed Forces during the late 22nd century

ThingDef.label: M12A1 Rocket Launcher
ThingDef.description: A single-use rocket launcher that fires a massive explosive projectile. Good against large groups of soft targets. Starts fires.\n\nBecause of its unwieldiness, single-use limitation, and the massive destruction it causes, it's said that one must be slightly crazy to use this weapon.

ThingDef.label: M37A3 Pump Shotgun
ThingDef.description: An ancient design of shotgun that emits a tight-packed spray of pellets. Deadly, but short range.

ThingDef.label: M39 Submachine Gun
ThingDef.description: The Armat Battlefield Systems M39 Submachine Gun, also known as the SMA7, was a submachine gun chambered for 10mm caseless ammunition. It was notably employed by the United States Colonial Marine Corps, United Americas and Three World Empire during the late 22nd century, and became one of the most successful Armat weapon after the M41A Pulse Rifle.

ThingDef.label: M41A3 Burst Rifle
ThingDef.description: The M41A3 Burst Rifle was a pulse action rifle manufactured by Armat Battlefield Systems and a variant of the M41A Pulse Rifle. It was used by the United States Colonial Marine Corps and United Americas during the late 22nd century.

ThingDef.label: M41A2 Pulse Rifle
ThingDef.description: The Armat M41A Pulse Rifle is a pulse-action assault rifle chambered for 10×24mm Caseless ammunition.[1] It was notably employed by the United States Colonial Marine Corps and the United States Army as their primary infantry weapon during the late 22nd century.

ThingDef.label: M41E4 Heavy Pulse Rifle
ThingDef.description: The Armat Battlefield Systems M41E4 Heavy Pulse Rifle was an American-made pulse-action heavy machine gun variant of the M41A Pulse Rifle. It was notably employed by the United States Colonial Marine Corps during the late 22nd century.

ThingDef.label: M42A3 Sniper Rifle
ThingDef.description: The M42A3 Sniper Rifle was a sniper rifle manufactured by Armat Battlefield Systems. It was derived from the M42A2 Scout Rifle and the successor of the M42A Scope Rifle, and was used by the United States Colonial Marine Corps, the Colonial Marines Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance Service, and the United Americas during the 22nd century.

ThingDef.label: M51 Breaching Scattergun
ThingDef.description: The M51 Breaching Scattergun, initially known as the Model 1771 Cobra Max Tactical, was a tactical/riot shotgun manufactured by Armat Battlefield Systems and used by the Office of the Colonial Marshals and the United States Colonial Marine Corps during the late 22nd century.

ThingDef.label: M94 Impact Grenade
ThingDef.description: The Armat Battlefield Systems M94 Impact Grenade was a grenade launcher chambered for M40 HEDP Grenades. It was notably employed by the United States Colonial Marine Corps and the Office of the Colonial Marshals during the late 22nd century.

ThingDef.label: M95 Grenade Launcher
ThingDef.description: The Armat Battlefield Systems M95 Grenade Launcher was a variant of the M94 Impact Grenade chambered for Mark 6 High Explosive Smart Bounce Grenades. It was used by the United States Colonial Marine Corps and other United Americas branches during the late 22nd century.

ThingDef.label: Mark 7 Mod 2 CQB Pistol
ThingDef.description: The Armat Battlefield Systems Mark 7 Mod 2 CQB Pistol, alternately referred as the Mark 7, was an American-made close-quarter battle machine pistol. It was notably employed by the United States Colonial Marine Corps and United Americas Aerospace Force during the 22nd century.

ThingDef.label: X43 Barrage Flechette SMG
ThingDef.description: The X43 Barrage Flechette SMG, alternately referred to as the Barrage, was an experimental submachine gun manufactured by Armat Battlefield Systems. It was notably employed by the Colonial Marines Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance Service and the United States Colonial Marine Corps during the late 22nd century.

ThingDef.label: X45 Bombard
ThingDef.description: Filling out Armat's Flechette line, the Bombard sits neatly between the X43 and X46, providing an accurate mid-range burst rifle that draws direct comparison to the venerable M41A3 Burst Rifle.

ThingDef.label: X46 Ballista Flechette
ThingDef.description: The X46 Ballista Flechette, alternately referred to as the Ballista, was an experimental sniper rifle manufactured by Armat Battlefield Systems and used by the Colonial Marines Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance Service and the United States Colonial Marine Corps during the late 22nd century.
